result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony Joseph Sevilla was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

COUNT 1:  The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
The Court advised the defendant of the following: possibility of deportation, firearm possession restriction and penalties, voting restriction. 

COUNT 2:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on state's motion, the Court orders Count 2 DISMISSED AND READ-IN for the purpose of sentencing in Count 1.


The state is in compliance with victim rights legislation.  The Court orders restitution set at zero.  Statements made as to sentencing by the state, defense, and defendant.   
 
COUNT 1:  The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 42 MONTHS, CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence being served with credit for 0 days. 
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 18 MONTHS.  The MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION IS 24 MONTHS.

The defendant IS NOT ELIGIBLE for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.  

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
*Obtain AODA assessment and complete any recommended follow-up care/treatment
*Cooperate with random urine screens
*No contact with victim Keith C. and victims in case 15CF003025 Ricardo P.-M. and Jonathan V.
*Obtain/maintain full time employment 

COURT FURTHER ORDERS defendant to:
*Provide DNA sample- pay surcharge;
*Pay all applicable mandatory surcharges, fees, assessments, and costs 

The Court ordered all financial obligations for this case and case 15CF003025 to be paid through collection of sums by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any remaining balance to convert to civil judgment.  Defendant advised of his right to appeal this sentence.

Filed;
-Pictures (x2)
-Letters (x2)
-Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
-Pretrial Incarceration Credit
-Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence-copy to defendant
